alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Clinton; Daviess; DeKalb (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 05 at 5:28PM CST until March 05 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Kansas City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pleasant Hill has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Daviess County in north central Missouri... Northeastern Clinton County in northwestern Missouri... Northwestern Caldwell County in north central Missouri... Southeastern DeKalb County in northwestern Missouri... * Until 600 PM CST. * At 528 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Cameron, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Cameron, Hamilton, Gallatin, Jamesport, Kidder, Winston, Altamont and Lock Springs. This includes Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 50 and 62. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for northwestern Missouri. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 900 PM CST for north central Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for northwestern Missouri. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 900 PM CST for north central Missouri.
